title: SoFi Technologies, AMC, Salesforce, Snowflake: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today; SoFi Technologies lifted its earnings guidance; Snowflake results are due after the close
text:
* Shares of crude producers were broadly higher premarket as oil prices extended their recent gains. Exxon Mobil, ConocoPhillips, Occidental Petroleum. Exxon said it is halting operations at a multibillion-dollar oil and gas project in Russia and will make no further investments in the country.

* Shares of one-time meme stock AMC Entertainment slipped 1.5% premarket, though the theater chain reported a better-than-expected profitability metric for the latest quarter as it welcomed back moviegoers.

* Salesforce.com added 3.8% of the bell. The business software provider logged higher revenue in the fourth quarter and raised its annual sales outlook.

* Dollar Tree and Abercrombie & Fitch are due to report results before the open.

* Abbott Laboratories gained 1.2% premarket. The company added another lot of Similac formula to its recall list as the FDA investigates several infant hospitalizations and two deaths.

* Hewlett Packard Enterprise rose 5.8%. The company raised its earnings forecast for the year after reporting stronger-than-expected earnings for the January quarter.

* Shares of solar-panel maker First Solar fell more than 15% premarket after its quarterly sales fell short of Wall Street expectations and its 2022 sales guidance was lower than estimates.

* Snowflake, Okta and Splunk are among the companies reporting earnings after Wednesday's close.

Chart of the Day

* Money managers are taking extraordinary steps to steady exchange-traded funds exposed to Russia. The closure of the country's stock market this week has created a rift between the pricing of some funds and the value of their underlying assets. That essentially leaves investors guessing at the value of the Russian assets.

Write to James Willhite at james.willhite@wsj.com
